===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|きつね}}
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
Various theories. The most likely is based on the root form ''kitsu'', which may have originally been [[onomatopoeic]] for the sound of a fox's cry.<ref>'''1937''': ''Daigenkai'' (in Japanese). Reissued in 1984. ISBN 4-572-00062-X</ref> The final ''ne'' syllable appeared for certain by the [[w:Heian period|Heian period]],<ref name="sasama">'''1998''': {{lang|ja|『怪異・きつね百物語』}} (''Yōkai: Kitsune Hyaku Monogatari'', “Phantoms: 100 Fox Tales”; in Japanese). Yoshihiko Sasama. ISBN 4-639-01544-5</ref> but the meaning of the ''ne'' portion remains unclear.
